_header: Man ne hath not grace for God give it not
Author(s): John Grimestone; Saint Anselm of Canterbury (attrib.)
_description: God’s grace — one couplet translating ‘Homo non habet graciam non quia hanc non dat Deus’, attributed in the MS to Anselm, which precedes it in John Grimestone’s sermon notebook

NLS18721.Transcription:
Manne hat nouth grace for God ȝef hit nouthBut for it is nouth
                    rediliche of man isouth
NLS18721.Editions:
Wilson,  Edward. 
             A Descriptive Index of the English Lyrics in John of Grimestone’s
                Preaching Book.
Medium Ævum Monographs
         n.s. 2. Oxford, 1973: 17.
